page.title: 03MILTON ABBAS.
page.content: {Milton Abbas}is an unique village set in a valley 11 miles from Dorchester and 8 miles from Blandford Forum. The two rows of charming thatched cottages stretch down to a lake which is almost a mile away from{Milton Abbey}now a famous boys'{Public School.}The one inn, Hambro Arms, is named after the banking family which once lived in the village. There is also in the village a tea room and a gift shop plus general stores, post office, art group a branch of the Women's Institute and a flourishing playgroup. A regular bus service, the only one, runs to Dorchester twice a week. Milton Abbas is particularly renowned for its biennial{Street Fair}where all proceeds are distributed amongst the local community organisations.
